We are currently seeking a Solution Architect – Clinical Imaging to join our team Remote based in the United States.

Summary:
We are seeking a highly skilled Solution Architect with extensive experience in clinical imaging technologies, specifically in radiology and cardiology. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating high-level designs, understanding dependencies, configurations, and installation requirements. This role involves working closely with integration and infrastructure teams to define installation types and critical hardware dependencies, as well as integration touchpoints with EMRs and other image transmission systems. Experience with either PACS or CPACS is acceptable as these are the main systems within their ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities:
High-Level Design: Create high-level designs for new demands or work, focusing on application-level dependencies, configurations, and installations.
Integration: Collaborate with integration and infrastructure teams to define installation types and critical hardware dependencies as well as understanding integrated systems, scalability, security, and compliance in the context of clinical imaging technology.
System Knowledge: Maintain and apply up-to-date knowledge of discrete and integrated information systems elements.
Problem Resolution: Resolve escalated problems, identify root causes, and determine appropriate approaches to ensure resolution.
Stakeholder Interaction: Work with vendors, internal CI staff, and local clinical team members, requiring strong soft skills and the ability to navigate a large organization.
Technology Versatility: Be well-versed with multiple image technologies and solutions, adapting to different product suites as needed as well as design and manage the integration of PACS, CPACS, and other imaging systems.
Foundational Architecture Knowledge: Understanding of systems architecture used consistently within or across the organization.
Soft Skills: Strong organizational skills, ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, and a proactive approach to finding answers and solutions.

Basic Qualifications:
Must have 8+ years of Clinical Imaging Technology experience
Must have 5+ years of Solutions/ Enterprise Architecture experience.
Must have experience with either PACS or CPACS as this position supports both Radiology and Cardiology.
Must have experience with technologies such as PowerScribe 360, RapidAI, ViewPoint, Merge Hemo, or Client CardioLab.
Must have Healthcare Provider industry experience or related, such as Hospital Systems, Clinic environments, Healthcare/Medical, etc.
Must have an Associate's degree, or Bachelor's, or High school diploma/GED with 5 years of experience.

Preferred Skills:
Leadership or Management experience considered an asset.
TOGAF is preferred but not required.
Experience with any other Clinical Imaging technologies is considered an asset.
Other Enterprise Architecture frameworks could be acceptable alternatives and/or considered an asset.

Koddi Engineers drive innovation by embracing challenges and deploying emerging technologies to solve complex problems in software development.

We need an upbeat and innovative Platform Engineer to join our technology team at Koddi. In this role you will collaborate with our software engineers, AI and ML scientists and other IT team members to ensure successful deployments and operation of services, design and implement our platform infrastructure, and play a major role in our continuous improvement. We are looking for a Platform Engineer who can merge the barriers surrounding our software development, our testing, and our operations teams.
What you will do
Design, implement, and maintain scalable, secure, and reliable cloud infrastructure for our SaaS platform
Collaborate with software engineering teams to ensure smooth deployment and operation of services
Maintain critical applications on cloud-native microservices architecture
Implement automation, effective monitoring, and infrastructure-as-code
Manage our continuous integration and delivery pipeline to maximize efficiency
Iterate on best practices to increase the quality and velocity of deployments
Ensure compliance with security best practices and industry standards
Participate in 24/7 on-call rotations for mission-critical systems
Identify infrastructure problems before they happen and implement solutions that detect and prevent outages
Secure, scale, and manage Linux (and possibly Windows) environments
Continuously evaluate existing systems against industry standards and make recommendations for improvement
Work collaboratively with multiple agile teams to help deliver end-to-end products and features, seeing them through from conception to delivery
Deliver strategic initiatives, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with established goals
Assist in developing strategic plans for your cross-functional team, aligning with overall business objectives
Continue to keep the lights on (day-to-day administration)
What skills and experience you bring
5+ years experience in a DevOps/Platform role in Cloud-Based production environments with strict SLAs
Strong experience in all key cloud services: EC2, S3, EKS, ECS, RDS, VPC, R53 and their equivalent counterparts in either Azure or GCP.
Strong experience with utilizing established tools for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) (Terraform preferred)
Configuration Management (Ansible preferred)
Observability and Alerting (Datagod preferred), Alerting (PD or OG)
Provable experience in managing CI/CD pipelines with two or more of: Github Actions, Jenkins, ArgoCD, TravisCI
Experience in Linux system administration, with proficiency in both Python and Bash
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues
Solid communication skills and a proactive, team-oriented mentality
Experience providing feedback to leadership on strategic initiatives

As part of that commitment, we’ve launched Koddi Academy—a learning platform designed to provide expert knowledge, competitive insights, and practical strategies for thriving in this fast-growing industry. Explore our latest certification course, Commerce Media Foundations, to deepen your expertise and stay ahead in the evolving world of commerce media. You can also sign up for our waiting list to be notified when new courses are released. Get started today at Koddi Academy.

At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Always. We’re ambitious. We’re game changers. And we play to win. We set the highest standards and execute beyond them. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the ultimate career opportunity that will light a fire within you.
The NICE Public Safety & Justice business helps all types of public safety and criminal justice agencies, from emergency communications and police to prosecutors and courts, digitally transform how they manage digital evidence and data from beginning to end, to get to the truth faster. NICE’s Evidencentral platform features an ecosystem of integrated technologies that bring data together to give a single view of the truth, enabling public safety and justice agencies to do what they do better – whether it’s responding to incidents, investigating, and building cases, or prosecuting crimes.
So, what’s the role all about?
A NICE Public Safety Account Executive's primary objective is to successfully position NICE and its solution portfolio to customers, prospects and partners within the Public Safety sector throughout the Mid-Atlantic. This person will work with the various functions within the company such as; Solutions engineering, Business Development, Project Management, Marketing, Professional Services and Customer Support.
How will you make an impact?
Achieve assigned sales quota(s) by: (a) selling directly to assigned accounts and (b) supporting the sales efforts of in-territory Partner channels
Execute on prospecting/lead generation/cold calling/networking to uncover new sales opportunities
Continually learn market needs and future trends in the Public Safety sector
Deliver presentations to end users, Partners and consultants
Work with Sales Engineering team to ensure solution configurations are designed correctly and will maximize the customer’s investment
Sell NICE value, differentiating between NICE and its competitors when presenting value proposition to potential and existing customers
Present regular status reports to management regarding pipeline creation and maturation
Have you got what it takes?
5+ years experience selling into Government verticals and/or in to the overall Public Safety/Security industry
Proven track record of success in working with Business Partners, Systems Integrators and end users
Proven ability to secure appointments with Public Safety Directors and Chiefs
Experience in working with government Purchasing personnel related to RFP/Bid responses and state and/or federal contracts
Proven consultative selling style with experience in proposal preparation
Strong technical knowledge
Travel requirement will be 50% per month within assigned territory
You will have an advantage if you also have:
